website_summaries.verdict: Everlast's Protex 2 training gloves are specifically designed for women in mind with more contoured construction and ventilation without sacrificing wrist protection and padding.
pros: Very good multi-purpose training gloves with good padding and protection
Ring foam collar system reduces wrist hyperinflation
Best suited for heavy bag work, focus padding and sparring
cons: Might have a chemical odor when new

customer_reviews.title: These gloves are pretty much like what some of the Pros use
customer_reviews.text: These are the gloves you want to have! For 16 oz gloves (which are on the heavier side) these are not overly heavy on your hands. These gloves are pretty much like what some of the Pros use. I use these 3-4 times a week in boxing class training alongside former and current boxers. One major key to these gloves over others is the wrist support. The gloves come down right to the cusp of my forearm. this is critical for hard punchers like me, so not to injure your wrists. Everlast makes quality equipment. These are a certain upgrade over my Title gloves that are now collecting dust.
customer_reviews.author: The Truth Teller

customer_reviews.title: Elastic tears!
customer_reviews.text: I have had two pairs of these gloves. Three of four have split where the Velcro fastener meets to elastic band that fastens the glove. I train three times a week doing bag and muay thai padwork--gloves lasted two months at best before starting to tear. I use duct tape to keep them together now. Am going to send them back and hopefully they will be replaced with at least one serviceable pair.
customer_reviews.author: SpreadEagleBeagle

customer_reviews.title: Not satisfied
customer_reviews.text: Not satisfied, after less than a 2 weeks of gentle use (3 times a week) the thread that holds the Velcro of the left glove started to unravel (the strap you pull to tighten the glove around the wrist). The Velcro has not completely separated but it will with continued use and then the gloves will no longer be usable. This is the only problem I have however, it is still a big one. I would like to think I just purchased a defective glove because I have had no problems with the other glove.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan W.

customer_reviews.title: Ripped after less than 10 uses
customer_reviews.text: I had a higher end version of these gloves for over five years. They had a thick flap that wrapped all the way around. I think that model was discontinued. I got these gloves which looked very similar. True to other people's experience, the flap ripped after about 7 workouts on the bag.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good quality and protection
customer_reviews.text: This product has good quality. The synthetic leather is fairly tough and the padding offers good protection for beginners hitting the punching bag; just don't forget to wrap your hands. Gloves don't provide protection without hand wraps.
customer_reviews.author: Faisal Al Fayez

customer_reviews.title: They are falling apart
customer_reviews.text: The straps that hold it in place from slipping out is coming apart. The gloves are great but this part needs to be more heavy duty.
customer_reviews.author: Eddie Alvarez Jr

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use on your own
customer_reviews.text: Great fit for large hands - very secure with or without wrapping up
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Good 🥊 glove
customer_reviews.text: I always liked this glove. I had a pair given to me at a gym. My old Everlasts fell apart so I wore the free ones for a while but now happy to have a new pair of my favorites
customer_reviews.author: Patricia Pavlak

customer_reviews.title: These are nice, but one of the pieces of Velcro came ...
customer_reviews.text: These are nice, but one of the pieces of Velcro came unstitched about a week after purchased. So much for "everlast".
customer_reviews.author: Stan Culotte

customer_reviews.title: Not durable for that kind of money!!
customer_reviews.text: I have worn these three times and the black covering is coming off already! My original pair I had for over 7 years and replaced with the exact same ones and the obviously are not the same if they are falling apart for third time wearing them! Now it’s past the return period...so mad!😡
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer T.

customer_reviews.title: Hurts the tips of your fingers
customer_reviews.text: Could not hit the heavy bag correctly with the amount of pain on the finger tip area on both hands. Tried getting Everlast to return the product but did not hear back from them. Straps are more difficult to put on and off then version 1 of these gloves.
customer_reviews.author: Carlos P.

customer_reviews.title: Best Boxing Gloves ever
customer_reviews.text: Best Boxing Gloves ever! I had two sets but in a moment of weakness, I gave them to My nephew! I can't wait for My second Pair to arrive so I can enjoy them again!
customer_reviews.author: Antonio B.

customer_reviews.title: Poor Construction
customer_reviews.text: I am very disappointed in the durability of these gloves. After only 5-6 times of working the heavy bag, the stitching along the Velcro came undone and I had to take my still like new gloves to an upholstery seamstress to have them redone.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsey

customer_reviews.title: Can't Strap Them On
customer_reviews.text: When putting my gloves on I usually put strap the first one with my ungloved hand and then use my teeth to pull the strap shut on the second glove. However, I seem to be inept at getting these straps shut. It is very annoying. I thought the gloves were okay otherwise. I will be returning these.
customer_reviews.author: Rose S.

customer_reviews.title: perfect
customer_reviews.text: great for home training fit well on my hands every time .
customer_reviews.author: Frank Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Not the heavy durable gloves i expected.  they don't tighten at wrists.
customer_reviews.text: Not the heavy durable gloves i expected. they don't wrap around your writsts securely enough.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Satisfied Customer
customer_reviews.text: Very good quality, would recommend to anyone, nice fit on your hand, very comfortable, feels great on punching bag
customer_reviews.author: Freddy Soledad

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Gloves
customer_reviews.text: I love the gloves, they are amazing for heavy workout as well as for sparring. I already have it for 2 years and are still on excelent conditions. I suggest to buy some deodorant and ventilate it after workout because it will start to smell.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It is a good pair of gloves for the price
customer_reviews.text: These gloves serve their purpose. I've used many gloves in the past to hit the heavy bag, spar, and hit the mitts and these are middle of the road as far as comfort and protection. It is a good pair of gloves for the price.
customer_reviews.author: GenoSmith210254

customer_reviews.title: Wouldn’t recommend
customer_reviews.text: These gloves had a great fit, but started tearing almost immediately. Wouldn’t recommend
customer_reviews.author: Peter

customer_reviews.title: Great gloves, nice support
customer_reviews.text: Nice set of gloves. Great wrist support, fist padding perfect!
customer_reviews.author: tech2

customer_reviews.title: Do Not Fit Well
customer_reviews.text: Do not fit well. No room for fingers at end of glove.
customer_reviews.author: Austin Glasgow

customer_reviews.title: but still worked great. I was surprised to find an "inspirational" note ...
customer_reviews.text: it was bigger than i thought, but still worked great. I was surprised to find an "inspirational" note on the underside of the glove
customer_reviews.author: ICEETONY

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Good Glove during training but after 5 months already torn at base velcro area. Need to have professionally sewn or buy a new pair.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Schain

customer_reviews.title: Damaged
customer_reviews.text: Thought these were new but one glove had the black material peeling off already
customer_reviews.author: Brooke

customer_reviews.title: 👎🏿
customer_reviews.text: Garbage, fell apart literally 2 days out of return window
customer_reviews.author: Sharon L Hardesty

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: They ripped at the strap seam within a couple of weeks
customer_reviews.author: Jose Hernandez

customer_reviews.title: really good for the price and comfortable on my hands i ...
customer_reviews.text: really good for the price and comfortable on my hands i want to try more different types of pro tex
customer_reviews.author: Chyenne

customer_reviews.title: Gloves fit well
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the Everlast Pro Style Training Gloves Black, 16 oz at first, and had to return because of a tear in the gloves, and also the gloves were very tight and uncomfortable. After returning those I purchase the Everlast Protex 2 glove and they are a good fit even with hand wraps. I would recommend purchasing this pair of gloves.
customer_reviews.author: jams25

customer_reviews.title: Knockout!
customer_reviews.text: Quality boxing gloves for a great workout. Comfortable with lots of room for protecting fingers and hands. I'm a gal with small hands and the 12 oz. gloves are perfect for me. Love the velcro closures! Would recommend these gloves fists down!
customer_reviews.author: Toni Abdnour

customer_reviews.title: Good gloves but I think I got a bad pair
customer_reviews.text: Best price I found and arrived in good time. The Velcro on the right glove ripped after 5 uses. So had to re-sew it. Also, not sure if they're too big but my right and hurts after each use. I've used 8oz gloves and my hand doesn't hurt at all.
customer_reviews.author: Tony

customer_reviews.title: Easy fasten but not tight
customer_reviews.text: The Velcro is very easy to fasten how ever it isn't as tight as I wanted it around my wrist.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: so good and broken in
customer_reviews.text: not a expensive glove- and i bought used,so good and broken in! a good feel to them, only had short period- but in use 5-6 days aweek, and they stand up to bag-sparring-mitt work nicely
customer_reviews.author: CARLOS

customer_reviews.title: Not a fan of their velcro feature!!!
customer_reviews.text: Having the worse time keeping the velcro on during sparring! Argh!!! Keep ripping open!
customer_reviews.author: Charlie S.

customer_reviews.title: I use these gloves for a Rock Boxing class (Parkinson's ...
customer_reviews.text: I use these gloves for a Rock Boxing class (Parkinson's Disease) and they are the correct weight and size. Thank you
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great service!
customer_reviews.text: Unable to really rate the product since I got the wrong size, but the customer service was great! I was slightly trepidant given that there are a few negative feedbacks about returns etc, but frankly MMAOneStopShop were really accomodating and helpful, much appreciated!!
customer_reviews.author: Patrick

customer_reviews.title: great price
customer_reviews.text: are rely comfortable gloves the get training at the gym I recommend you, fast shipping, great price and easy to buy...
customer_reviews.author: Mateo Garcia L.

product_meta.title: Everlast Elite Protex2 Training Gloves
product_meta.description: The Everlast Protex 2 training gloves combine technological innovation and ergonomic design to provide you with maximum power. Protex 2 wrist stabilization technology system provides superior wrist protection and comfort. The EverDri™ liner with anti-microbial treatment keeps your hands dry, comfortable and odor free.
